ygData.subject: Deep Thoughts.
ygData.msgSnippet: * She kept a tight hold on the tiny kitten as he struggled and sounded his discomfort. He reached out to intocate something but Iron Raptor only moved her arm

* She kept a tight hold on the tiny kitten as he struggled and sounded his 
discomfort. He reached out to intocate something but Iron Raptor only moved 
her arm so that he couldn't see past it and only could notice what was 
ahead.
Iron Raptor heard/saw well just what Prowl was thinking the wondered if men 
could get any denser. (no offence to males.) By Prowl's opinion it was 
alright to meet eachother one day and basically be in bed together a few 
days later...which is basically what they did.
He had rights to his thoughts and so did she, so she said nothing of it.
Iron Raptor sighed when Prowl asked her the question she had been expecting 
since she had thought up those opinions on their relationship so far.
And she wasn't afraid to be blunt about it.
< No, I don't.>
She openly regreated it. A mistake.
She didn't regret the love expressed, just that it was too soon and she 
barely even knew him now. Besides, she could only read the parts of his mind 
that he decided to show her, and those were the parts he thought about.
Iron Raptor glanced at Prowl.
All she knew was his name and what his part in the Beast Wars was.
She didn't know where he came from, though had a hunch that it was from 
Cybertron.
She didn't know if he had any family, previouse lived, anything like that 
she knew exactly Zippo about.
But he really didn't know her all that well either.
Not where she came from, not what she was, nothing.
It was time to get to work on those sorts of things.
She did love him. Or what she thought she felt was love.
Iron Raptor sighed inwardly.
From a manufactoring date she was lass then 11 years old, and that was new 
for a prototype. But her mind was advanced not because it was programmed to 
but because she had learned in a very quick amount of time, and so had a 
mature view of life from day 1.
But there was still so much to learn, like the emotions she was surrounded 
by every day and ones which clouded her mind all too often. So she wanted to 
go slow, to get every detale, even in matters like love.
And that's part of why that day was a mistake.*
